subject: Re: new font released
msgSnippet: Hi Paul, I just took a quick look at your Thoth font and have one quick question.  It looks like Thoth has all 40 of the numbered characters, plus the yoo
messageBody:
Hi Paul,

I just took a quick look at your Thoth font and have one quick
question. It looks like Thoth has all 40 of the numbered characters,
plus the "yoo" and "air" characters shown on the second page of the
pdf file for the "QuikScript Manual". But it only has 49 of the 51
symbols shown in Jon Zuck's "Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read".
The characters for "Ian" and "Earth" are missing. I was wondering
why those two symbols were omitted. It seems like it would be nice to
have complete compatibility with the Jerome and Kingsley fonts.

I haven't read all your messages regarding Thoth, so if you've already
addressed this, I apologize.

Thanks,
Jeff Smith


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
>
> I have released a new font, which you can find in the files section in
> the fonts directory. The new font is called Thoth. It also has a
> counterpart, ThothUni, the Unicode version.
>
> The Unicode version is based on the popular Gentium font, so it
contains
> thousands of glyphs, and one can use just ThothUni to mix up
Traditional
> orthography and QS in the same document by using just one font.
>
> I consider Thoth to still be in its testing stage, so I appreciate any
> feedback. In the zip file you will find the two fonts and a number of
> PDF documents that I created using this font. The font looks best
with a
> program that recognizes the kerning (special space between
letters). I
> found that only XeLaTeX and InDesign recognized kerning. For this
> reason, I included the PDF produced with XeLaTeX so you can see what
the
> font looks like displayed properly.
>
> Paul
>
